body.name: Seven Nights with the Duke of Sin: A Steamy Historical Regency Romance Novel (Rules of Rakes Book 1)
body.description: "Seven nights. Spend seven nights with me, Emma, and you shall have your dowry back."To Emma, being forced into the Season merely months after her father’s sudden death was the worst thing to have ever happened to her. Until her horrible cousin loses her dowry and inheritance in a gamble with the infamous Duke of Sin.The Duke of Sinclair lives by one golden rule: never spend more than seven nights with the same woman. And despite his taste for gambling, he would never allow his heart to be put on the table for a woman.Emma should have known Sin was trouble the moment he demanded payment after rescuing her at the ball. Only…she never expected that he would make her such an indecent proposal: spend seven nights with him to get her dowry back… Seven Nights with the Duke of Sin is a steamy Regency romance and the first one in the spicy Rules of Rakes Series.If you like sexy Dukes, sassy Ladies, and spicy romances, then buy Loretta Levine’s sizzling hot debut novel today!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The things women must do to keep what little belongs to them
reviews.reviewText: To his credit Edward realizes he is wrong. Emma is brave to fight for what belongs to her. Not many women would be able to hold to their convictions to do whatever it takes!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was my first book by this author. Overall, it was a good read. There was angst, passion, and intrigue. At first, things were really fast paced and moved right along. A little over halfway through, things seemed to slow down a bit and then by the end, it was flying. The pacing threw me for a bit, so that was the hardest part of the story.Overall, the story was interesting and fun. I liked Edward and his complex background. I liked it enough to look for the next book and see what happens to the other characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Loretta Levine is a new to me author
reviews.reviewText: I just finished the book Seven Nights with the Duke and I thoroughly enjoyed this book. I first found the link in Facebook to learn about the book’s description and after reading the description I really believed that this would be a really great book for me and a story line I would thoroughly enjoy. Even though I hadn’t read any other book by Loretta, I wanted to take a chance and I’m glad I did. It was a book that once I started I had to finish and not read any other books, which I have done in the past. I really did enjoy this book as it had Great characters with Edward being the Duke and Emma the lady that he gives the option of spending the Seven nights with him to receive her inheritance back. But only if she went along with being with him the Seven nights and then they will go their separate ways. This book has a Cinderella feel to it, as Emma has some relatives due to her father’s death that she is is forced to live with and go by their rules. I love stories about rogue Dukes and as you read further into the book you understand why he only wants to spend only Seven nights with women, that is until he met Emma. I will definitely be checking more books by this author! The descriptions of all of the characters plus the clothes they wore was really something I enjoy also. 5 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ for this book! And also there is a great Epilogue and an option for getting the second Epilogue which is so worth it. I loved the cover of the book also.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars a little choppy and lots of loose ends
reviews.reviewText: There were a lot of things going on that kept the action going, but really choppy going from one situation to another. Also read sometimes like a Jane Austin novel, then an exotica novel. Talk about whiplash!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Emma could have been a little bit stronger . She was being a lady . But that cousin hers was a bully . They paid in the end . I like reading about smart women being strong .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I definitely read this book in 2 days and that’s how good it was it. I love the tension between our main characters. The steam was the right amount. My only issue is the ending, it felt rushed and needed to be more fleshed out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Seven Nights with the Duke of Sin
reviews.reviewText: This story of Emma and Edward was very entertaining. The story line was great. The mystery and intrigue made for a very interesting story. A perfect ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another great read
reviews.reviewText: This was such a fun book to read. I fell in love with both Emma and Sin. It is really fun to see the two of them interact and both of them not wanting to admit that they are attracted to each other. She was rescued by him and he was trying to take advantage of helping her. He doesn't want to admit that he wants more than 7 nights with her, and she doesn't want to admit that she wants the same after a bit. Buy it, read it and get in on the fun of seeing of seeing how things turn out. You won't regret it, a great fun summer read. Grab a glass of ice tea, put phone away and snuggle in a comfy place and read it.
Quite a delightful tale with shades of Cinderella. Well written and entertaining with a little bit of everything to keep you enthralled. Didn’t want to put it down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Seven Nights with the Duke of Sin.
reviews.reviewText: I loved the whole story of Edward and Emma's exciting love story. With a surprised but joyful ending. With wonderful character 's good and bad. I highly recommend this book.

Emma struggles to get away from her cruel aunt and cousins by marrying but her cousin gambles away her dowry in a game of cards.The winner is Edward, the „Duke of Sin“, known for his short liaisons which never last longer than seven nights.Edward is willing to waive the dowry if Emma in return agrees to spend seven nights with him... HEA guaranteed!I was caught up by the story right from the beginning. I loved the main and the side characters, the chemistry between Emma and Edward and their sensual, steamy encounters.I have really enjoyed reading this book and can‘t wait for the next of the series.

🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟This is a debut from L. Levine. The story is written so well it attests to the author's gift in writing. I think it is loosely based on a Cinderella story, with a strong twist. There's no 2 ugly step-sisters, but an ugly stepsister and stepbrother. Still, the operative word here is Ugly, whether physically is not mentioned, but def in personality. The book has different layers that takes the reader through humour, drama, hot sensual romance, suspense, intrigue, crimes and misdemeanours, and of course a Happily Ever After.The characters were well created and believable. There was no overdose of sensual narrative, just enough to establish the sizzling chemistry between the hero and heroine. It was also spaced out in sections throughout the pages, not just lumped all at the end. Then that would be really boring and tedious for me. I am no prude, but I also draw the line at erotica. This author has managed to balance out all the essential requisites of a successful historical romance novel with an adept stroke of her pen or keyboard.I hope there will be another book soon. I will definitely buy it. I totally recommend this book.

Honestly, not the best book I've read. It felt like the author was plucking bits from Bridgerton and Pride & Prejudice and didn't really make anything unique.The writing felt basic. Though it was technically all proper grammer and punctuation, it didn't feel creative.This had a lot of potential, and it wasn't bad enough that I couldn't finish it. I would like to see where this author ends up in the future, given time to develop their skills.
